text: John Nicolas Choate (1848–1902) was an American photographer in Carlisle, Pennsylvania known for his glass plate negative images of the Carlisle Indian School, scenic shots, and images of the town and townspeople. Dickson College has a collection of his glass plates. ==References== Category:1848 births Category:1902 deaths Category:Photographers from Pennsylvania Category:People from Carlisle, Pennsylvania Category:19th-century American photographers
title: John Nicolas Choate
